Detailed Description

Our belief about the ball's current position and velocity.

Member Function Documentation

◆ make_trajectory()

planning::Trajectory BallState::make_trajectory ( ) const

Create a trajectory for the ball.

Returns
A trajectory for this ball to follow. Angles are meaningless.

◆ predict_at()

BallState BallState::predict_at ( RJ::Time  time) const

Predict the ball's state at a particular instance in time.

Parameters
Timethe time at which to evaluate the ball's position.
Returns
The ball's state.

◆ predict_in()

BallState BallState::predict_in ( RJ::Seconds  seconds) const

Similar to predict_at(RJ::Time), but for a duration in the future (offset calculated from the ball's sample time).

Parameters
secondsThe offset from this ball's sample time at which to predict its motion.
Returns
The ball's motion at the specified duration after this sample.

◆ query_seconds_to_dist()

std::optional< RJ::Seconds > BallState::query_seconds_to_dist ( double  distance) const

Query the time before the ball goes a certain distance. Return nullopt if it will stop before traveling the specified distance.

Parameters
distanceThe distance along the ball path at which to query.
Returns
The time at which the ball will hit the specified distance, or nullopt.

◆ query_stop_position()

rj_geometry::Point BallState::query_stop_position ( ) const

Predict the stop position of the ball.

Returns
The point at which the ball will stop.

◆ query_stop_time()

RJ::Seconds BallState::query_stop_time ( rj_geometry::Point *  out = nullptr) const

Predict the stop time of the ball.

Parameters
outwill be filled with the stopping position, if it is not nullptr.
Returns
The duration until the ball stops.

◆ query_time_near()

RJ::Time BallState::query_time_near ( rj_geometry::Point  near_to,
rj_geometry::Point *  out = nullptr 
) const

Estimate the instant in time at which the ball will reach the given position (or the nearest point along the line of its path).

@detail If the ball will never reach the nearest point along its line, return the ball's endpoint and time.

Parameters
near_toThe query point
outThe nearest point to near_to along the path.
Returns
The instant in time at which the ball is nearest to near_to.
